content:
Welcome to Mini Normal 1874, also known as Camping Trip Mafia! You have decided to leave your home, civilization and all modern technology and comforts behind to sleep in a tent providing nutrition for mosquitoes in an undisclosed location for an indefinite amount of time! After packing all necessary supplies and a few unhealthy snacks, you embarked on a journey to the middle of nowhere.

But as you get to the middle of nowhere, you discover 13 other people at the exact same camping spot. How inconvenient. You set up your tent next to all the other tents, then gather with your fellow campers to do awkward small talk.

After five minutes of uncomfortable conversation, everyone realizes that all 13 tents look exactly the same. Even worse, since there’s 14 people, and no one can remember which their own tent was, an argument breaks out over who gets to sleep in which tent.

This argument is interrupted by someone screaming at the top of their lungs. Everyone rushes over to follow the noise. They discover a corpse that has been stabbed, shot, burned and dismembered in a most gruesome fashion.

Leonshade was killed. He was a Vanilla Townie.

I guess that solves the tent problem!



01. General Rules
01.1 In addition to the rules below, regular site rules apply.
01.2 Do not break the rules. Do not pretend to break the rules. Pretending to break the rules will be treated as if you had actually broken the rule in question.
01.3 The moderator's decision is final.
01.3.1 I am human, and make mistakes. If you see something that appears to be a mistake, tell me about it and I will fix it.
01.4 You may neither quote private communication with the mod, nor pretend to do so. This includes, but is not limited to, your role PM and anything posted by the mod in a private topic. Paraphrasing is allowed.
01.5 Discussing this game is only allowed via the methods provided by the moderator. Do not discuss this game with other players outside the game threads.
01.6 Using provable randomness is prohibited. This includes, but is not limited to, using dice tags in the game thread. Using, as well as claiming to use, random methods such as dice rolls is allowed.
01.7 Editing your posts is not allowed, in case you have the ability to do so.
01.8 Impersonating the mod is not allowed. I will be using orange as my mod color, so do not use that color, or similar colors.
01.9 Even if something isn't explicitly prohibited by the rules, the mod reserves the right to intervene if it's harming the game. This is the generic "toxic behavior" rule.

02. Setup & Mechanics
02.1 This setup was reviewed by borkjerfkin, Marquis and mhsmith0 for normalcy and balance.
02.2 Day phases will last for 14 days. Night phases will last for 2 days.
02.3 Extensions may be granted in the case of replacements, site downtime or similar situations. Requests for deadline extensions will be ignored outside extreme circumstances.
02.4 To vote,please use either the vote tags (VOTE: Player) or bold tags (VOTE: Player). Unvoting before a vote change is not necessary.
02.5 Abbreviated or misspelled names of players will still be counted as a vote, provided that it is clear whothe vote is for.
02.6 Lynching is achieved through simple majority. In other words, the lynch threshold is more than 50% of living players (half the players rounded down, plus one). If the deadline is reached without a lynch, or if a simple majority votes no lynch, no lynch will occur. If the number of living players is even, 50% of the living players is sufficient to no lynch.
02.7 Twilight begins when a lynch occurs, and lasts until the thread is locked. During twilight, all living players,including the player that was lynched, may continue to post.
02.8 Players may only use one ability per night. This includes the mafia's factional night kill ability. The only exception is if a mafia player with an ability is the sole living mafia player. In this case, they may use one night ability in addition to their factional ability.
02.9 This game uses Natural Action Resolution
02.10 All flavor is for entertainment purposes only. The flavor text has no relation to the setup or mechanics of this game.

03. Activity & Deadlines
03.1 A player will be prodded after 48 hours of inactivity. The prodded player has 24 hours to post in the thread before the search for a replacement begins.
03.2 A player who has been prodded three times will be replaced.
03.3 The weekend, as well as certain holidays, will have relaxed time constraints for activity. Saturday and Sunday count as one day for the purposes of activity.
03.4 If the Day ends while you have been prodded, but before you have had a chance to respond, you have until the end of the Night to PM the moderator declaring your ability to continue. If you do not do this, you may be replaced.
03.5 The deadlines are absolute. Votes during the Day or night actions during the Night made after the official deadline will not be counted.
03.6 Players may change their night action at any time within the constraints of the deadline, but not after the deadline has expired.
03.7 Players will not be prodded during V/LA. If you announce a V/LA, please let me know with a PM to make sure I don't miss it. If you will be on V/LA regularly, please let me know before the game.

Sample Role PM
Welcome to Mini Normal 1874!
You are a Vanilla Townie.
During the day, you may post in the game thread and use your vote. You have no abilities during the night.
You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one town player is still alive.
The game thread is here.
Please confirm your role and alignment to me via PM.

All role PMs have been sent out. The game will begin in (expired on 2017-01-26 16:49:17) or when 10/13 people have confirmed, whichever comes later.

Beginning of Day One

Beginning of Day Two

Beginning of Day Three
End of Day Three
End of Night Three

In honor of your late camping buddy, you decide burn Leonshade's body in a funeral pyre. As you're roasting marshmallows over the pyre, the topic of the discussion turns to the identity of the killer. It is obvious that the murder was pre-meditated, as the murder was far too brutal and complex for the attack to have been done in the heat of the moment. You also come to the conclusion that the killer must be another camper, as the location of the camp is far too remote to hide other people. With this realization, all of you become suspicious of one another, suddenly aware of the possibility of further murders. Unable to trust anyone else, with delicious marshmallows as your only true friends, your camping retreat has suddenly become a murder mystery.

Day 1 begins now.

With 11 players alive, it takes 6 votes to lynch.

Day 2 is over.

The constant deaths are getting to you. Grief, panic, despair, paranoia, you've been on a rollercoaster of negative emotions. But one man seems unfazed through it all. Sickofit attends to his daily tasks with a striking lack of fear, whistling as he gets up in the morning, whistling as he cooks his meal, whistling as he chops some firewood, whistling as he attempts to chop your head off. Wait, what was that last one?

You narrowly dodge the attack. You prepare to fight for your life, but in an instant, everyone else piles on to Sickofit, wrestling the axe from his grasp. You grab a rope and prepare a noose, putting an unsteady camping stool under the rope for Sickofit to stand on. As you tie the noose around Sickofit's neck, you demand that he confess to his crimes. "You murdered them, didn't you? Leonshade and TwoFace?"

"No," responds Sickofit, "I just watched as they were killed." An unhinged, sadistic glee appears on Sickofit's face. Sickofit starts whistling once again, as if facing death was just another chore in his daily life. Even as you kick the stool from under him, the whistling continues until Sickofit's last breath. The melody will haunt you in your dreams.

Sickofit1138 was lynched Day Two. He was a Mafia Roleblocker.

Night Two begins now. Night Two will end in (expired on 2017-02-18 04:09:49).

During the night, you find it impossible to sleep. You could swear that you can still hear Sickofit outside, whistling that hauntingly familiar melody. You toss and turn and the whistling seems to get louder and louder, until your curiosity gets the better of you and you decide to peek your head outside your tent, just in case. Your eyes grow wide as you see Sickofit's corpse, still hanging by his neck, whistling. His eyes are closed, but his lips are moving to produce the whistling that has been haunting you all night.

The paranormal events don't end there, as the funeral pyre lights up on its own, with the burning corpses of Leonshade and keyenpeydee forcing their way out of the pyre, shambling in your direction. You get out of your tent and try to escape into the woods, but TwoFace's bullet-riddled body stumbles out of the woods, one arm outstretched towards you. You get to the middle of the camp and yell for everyone to wake up. The movement coming out of the tents fills you with relief for a moment, but that relief changes to horror as eight bodies, each wounded with what should be fatal injuries, burst out of the tents. You are surrounded by walking corpses, each one headed for you.

For a moment, Sickofit's whistling stops, and the corpses stop along with it. You look up in Sickofit's direction to see him open his eyes and stare you right in your eyes. Sickofit's face twists into an expression of sadistic glee, an unnerving laughter emanating from deep within his body. The corpses start closing in on you once again, your screams falling on deaf ears as they grab a hold of you...

Your eyes jolt open. You examine your surroundings, finding yourself in the relative comfort of your tent. You peek outside your tent to discover that everyone is already awake. All ten of you.

Nobody died last night!

Day 3 is over.

Fykus was incredibly proud of his knife collection. He had a large and varied assortment of knives and he was always carrying at least a few of them with him. As the day draws to an end, Fykus is sitting by the campfire, sharpening one of his knives. He politely asks you to go fetch his knife sheath from his tent. You comply, heading to the tent Fykus points at and stepping inside. There can be no mistake that this is Fykus's tent, there are knives hanging from each side of the tent. However, your eyes are drawn to the one part of the tent in particular, where a number of pictures are hanging. In particular, pictures of every other person in the camp, with a slash going through the eyes of each person that has died so far. What is even more worrying is that there is a knife stabbed through your picture.

You're startled as Fykus appears at the entrance of the tent. Fykus throws a small knife at you, the knife narrowly flying over your head. There is no time for panic, you decide, quickly grabbing a hunting knife off the wall to defend yourself with. Unfortunately for you, Fykus is armed with his favorite knife, the one he's been sharpening all evening. He slashes at you, and while you attempt to block with your knife, when the knives collide you lose your grip on your weapon. Fykus kicks you down onto the ground and mounts you, holding his knife to your throat. You stare into his cold, dead eyes, unable to find a hint of emotion on Fykus's face as you plead for your life.

Suddenly, emotion does appear on his face. Pain. One of the other campers had snuck up on Fykus and just stabbed him in the back. The other campers show up, each taking turns stabbing Fykus in the back. Finally, you're able to push Fykus off. You wrestle Fykus's favorite knife from his hand and stab him in the heart, dealing the finishing blow to him.

Fykus has been lynched Day Three. He was a Mafia Goon.

Night Three begins now. Night Three will end in (expired on 2017-02-22 18:51:09).
Reminder: If all players PM me to do so, the night will be accelerated. In that case, I would re-open the thread as soon as I had received all nine PMs.

Once again, you have trouble sleeping at night. Your near-death encounter with Fykus is still bothering you, if the other campers had arrived even a second later, you might be dead right now. As you toss and turn, trying to fall asleep, you hear the sounds of a scuffle outside your tent. Certain that you're not dreaming this time, you muster up the courage to peek your head outside the tent.

You discover two of your fellow campers in the middle of the camp, their clothes crumpled and dirty from the fight they just had. One of them, SensFan, is on his knees with his hands in the air. The other, JupiterCrush, is standing in front of him, with a gun pointed to SensFan's forehead.

You, along with the other campers, get out of your tents, demanding to know what is going on. Some plead for JupiterCrush to put the gun down, and there are even accusations of him being the third person involved in the murders. But JupiterCrush shakes his head and refuses to put the gun down. "Look inside Nadpool's tent," he says, a hint of sorrow in his voice. You hesitantly agree to JupiterCrush's request, peeking inside Nadpool's tent. You find him lying with his eyes open and his throat cut.

Nadpool was killed Night Three. He was a Vanilla Townie.

"I caught SensFan red-handed," JupiterCrush says. "Literally." Focusing on SensFan's hands, you realize that JupiterCrush is telling the truth. It was easy to miss in the dark, but now that people were shining flashlights on him, the blood stains on SensFan's hands were apparent. "So you killed Nadpool?" You ask. "Why?"

Despite the situation he is in, SensFan is eerily calm. He turns his gaze at you, not a hint of fear in his eyes. "Why?" He repeats. "Because camping is so... boring." His answer takes you by surprise. "Boring?"

"Think back to the past few days. How much of it would you describe as fun, or exciting, or interesting? We are in the middle of nowhere, sleeping in uncomfortable tents, swatting away flies and mosquitoes. Camping is nothing more than denying yourself all the modern comforts of our daily lives for no reason. And yet this trip has been quite exciting, wouldn't you agree? And why is that?"

You think back to all the people that have been killed, all the days spent trying to figure out who's doing the killing, all the nights spent waiting in fear, wondering if you're going to be the next victim. The trip has been frightening, but you can't deny that it has also been exciting.

"It is all thanks to me. Fykus, Sickofit, they were just my pawns. I took a knife-wielding psychopath and a mentally unhinged sadist and turned them into entertainers. My little murder mystery is the only thing that has been spicing up our lives here. And now that you've solved the mystery, this trip has reached its end. A bit of an anti-climax, but what are you going to do. I never did like getting my hands dirty, perhaps it is best that this is over.

"This trip is indeed over," JupiterCrush says, "for you. As is your life."

A wide grin spreads over SensFan's face. "What are you going to do, kill me? We may be in the middle of nature, but that doesn't mean that the laws of man don't apply here. I may be a murderer, but if you end the life of a defenseless man, so are you. Lynching Sickofit was already bad enough, do you really want two murders on your hands? You will take me back to civilization and have me judged in a court of law, to do anything else would be vigilante justice."

You think back to Sickofit's lynch. Fear and the desire for vengeance had guided your hands, but SensFan was right. What you did was still murder.

"Vigilante justice, I like that," says JupiterCrush. "My fellow campers may be hesitant, but I'm not. Just this once, I will be a vigilante." Before anybody has time to react, JupiterCrush shoots SensFan. Unceremoniously, SensFan's body collapses to the ground.

SensFan was killed Night Three. He was a Mafia Goon.

THE GAME ENDS IN A TOWN VICTORY!

In post 1020, TwoFace wrote:This was town sided imo so glad that didn't happen again

I wouldn't really agree. Trackers are inherently mediocre roles, so a tracker and backup tracker isn't a huge deal (and town mislynching one of its PRs is something surprisingly common in mini normal games). Doctor improves the tracker role, but doctor/tracker is a strong combo in a micro game, but much weaker in a mini game where PR shots missing entirely is mechanically likelier. And the JOAT was merely ok; the JOAT rolecop shot hitting the roleblocker was a big boost for town, but that's swing rather than something fundamental (hitting either goon just says vanilla and there goes the utility of that shot).

Looking just at town's power, the roles themselves aren't fantastic, but they ARE coordinated pretty effectively (barring the JOAT horribly misusing the vig shot), which is where the roleblocker comes in. In mini normal games, roleblocker is considered the scum superpower; of all the normal roles that scum are currently allowed (i.e. not vanillaizer, vigilante, godfather, etc), roleblocker is the strongest by a substantial margin, as it can blast away at town power and shut it down pretty quickly.

OTOH, scum roleblocker pretty much has to be protected from suspicion and the lynch; in just about any mini normal game where the roleblocker bows out early (the only exceptions are where town power is mainly passive like masons, BP, etc), scum are going to be in big trouble.

In general, against a roleblocker, town has had at least one really strong power role, or multiple passives (like 1719). The JOAT isn't strong enough, and tracker is a middling town power in a 13p game.


You can pretty easily compare a couple prior games to this one that are somewhat similar setup wise:

1772: town got a doc, tracker (macho), and a full town roleblocker, and won
1662: town got a doc, tracker, and a full vig, and won

town was 2-0 in doc/tracker setups before this, but also had full useful powers (1772 was probably scumsided since town roleblocker isn't super useful) - comparing 1662 in particular to this one, town essentially trades a full vig (very very strong role though swingy) for a JOAT and a backup tracker

I'd also note that in rb/goon/goon setups, town frequently gets a cop (1794 is cop/doc/gunslinger agianst rb/goon/enrcyptor; 1653 was cop/doc/1-shot vig; 1596 was cop/doc/miller; 1527 was cop/bodyguard/2-shot vig). Here town's power was relatively diffuse, but I think it was overall balanced given how powerful a weapon scum roleblocker can be.

PS FWIW, doctor in particular can be subverted by roleblocker.  RB on doc = doc goes nowhere, doesn't save an obvious target on the board and/or gets tracked to nowhere.  Potentially an easy mislynch if played right and/or luckiliy by scum.
